args: That day, at the direction of the Mukuroshu,\nI poisoned the food at the inn, without being\ninformed of my target.
I left the premises, but out of unease, I went back\nto check on things. There was a great fuss already\nover the body that had been found.
The victim was my wife's grandfather—my own\nteacher. Even now, I cannot forget the look of\npain etched upon his features.
My enemy isn't you. It's the Mukuroshu,\nwho made you kill my grandfather.
If you regret everything you've done,\nthen fight with me.
You're awake at last. Oh dear, don't move\ntoo much. If you do, the chains will dig\ninto your flesh.
They got the drop on me...?\nWhere are Addis and Gozu Tenno?
Your little compatriots?\nThey turned tail and fled from our fiends.

More to the point, you're that assassin
who went AWOL. That manacaster of yours
has been sorely missed. I'm the one who
made it useable again, you know.
What of it? I'm in no mood for banter.
You came here with an attendant of one\nof the wyrmclan leaders and a pactwyrm.
You've used my caster. We're kin. If you\ntell me everything about the wyrmclan\nleaders, I'll forget about our little row.
Spare me your pity. Just tell me this:\nwho was the man that shot at me?
The man who shares my face.\nYou sent him after me earlier.
We've got not one like that here.
Don't play the fool with me. He set up the\nexplosive at the workshop in Hinomoto,\nand he tried to stop me in Quinbell.
The one who set up the blast at the\nHinomoto workshop was me.

And I sent subordinates to Quinbell for
preliminary checks for our test fire, but they
didn't have anything that would stand out
like a caster.
Then who was that man?!\nNo, wait...
?! Was that the sound of caster fire?!
What?! Where'd you hear it from?
Beware the Mukuroshu! That agent has\na caster!
It cannot be... He simply cannot be...
I don't know what you're on about, but\nyou won't be working for us again.

That chain binding you is a little
something we made called an osmocoil.
It's a magical implement that sucks the
life out of whoever it binds.

And while it leeches out your life, we're
going to take the Hellfyre for a test run.
You stay right there and wallow in your
frustration.
Wait. You said you sent people to Quinbell\nfor an inspection. You can't mean to...!

The skies above the village shall darken
with the merciless rain of weapon fire.
Their screams will echo all the way here
and serve as your final lullaby. Ha ha ha!
Stop! I won't let you do as you—hrk?!\nGaaaaah!
Ngh... The more I squirm, the faster\nthis thing sucks out my vitality.
You seem unhappy. I like that.
Do you truly believe that those who've lost\nfriends and family want their loved ones'\nkiller to have a fresh start at life?
No. What would comfort them is for the\nkiller to experience all the pain and fear\nand despair their murdered loved ones did.
Only after you die will your sins be atoned\nfor. And that death should be a gruesome\none.
It is as you say. I do not deserve to live.
But I cannot just die. Not here, not now.\nNot until I've done what I must do.
So what is your aim? To pile up as many\nMukuroshu corpses as people you killed?
To never live in a shameful way again.
Yachiyo told me—the man who killed her\ngrandfather—that she'd pull me out of the\nshadows and back into the light.
She believed that I could stand upright\nonce again. And so, I cannot die here!
I won't fall until I can crush evil, enact\njustice, and face Momoyo! Hraaaaaah!
It's useless. You cannot break free.\nYour death here is already assured.
No. Not until I put a stop to\nthe Mukuroshu's plot, it isn't!
My blade strikes as swift as the wind.\nI'm cutting you free!
I'm undoing the chains right now!
Sorry to leave you hangin'. The people\nwho were being controlled almost got\ncaught up in our fight with the fiends.
It took us some time to escort them to\nsafety.
Do not apologize. On the contrary, I would\nhave scolded you had you prioritized my\nown rescue.
More importantly, the Mukuroshu are\nabout to test fire their new weapon...\nand their target is Quinbell.
Many lives will be lost if we don't hurry\nand stop them—ngh!
Hey, you're a mess, guy.\nLeave it to us and take a breather.
This is a race against time. I cannot sit\nidly by and recover my strength. Besides...
If I can't fight to the bitter end now, then\nno matter how long I live, I'll never be\nable to accomplish anything.
So please, allow me to go. For the sake of\nmy soul, and the justice I must adhere to!
...Gozu Tenno, can you help him out?
I will carry you to where the Mukuroshu\nare.
It'd be smarter to just leave you,\nbeaten and battered as you are.
But I'm not the kind of guy who can just\nleave someone behind—especially when\nthey're as desperate as you are.
We will support you, Saiga. Let us go\ntogether. To do what must be done.
